html: A reversal of covenant curses for Jehovah’s people extends to their release from bondage to the powers of darkness: (1) spiritually—when they convert to the truth and renew their covenant with Jehovah; and (2) temporally—when he delivers them from the king of Assyria/Babylon who epitomizes darkness and Death. Jehovah’s “light” signifies both the terms of his covenant—which go forth as a “light” to the nations (Isaiah 51:4)—and his end-time servant, whom Jehovah appoints as a light to the nations (Isaiah 42:6; 49:6) to prepare them for Jehovah’s coming to establish his kingdom on the earth.
